name: The Ritz-Carlton Golf Resort, Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: -Staff…Welcoming, helpful and friendly
reviews.title: Ritz Naples Golf Resort…yet to disappoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Accommodations….Luxurious and traditional in its furnishing, The Naples Ritz is very comfortable. I have stayed in both standard rooms and executive suites and they are both quite comfortable. Cararra marble laden bathroom with tub and separate shower make the stay even more comfortable and accommodations even roomier.
reviews.title: A distinguished property well worth staying at in Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: -Food-Sunday brunch is a nice indulgence. Fresh, creative cuisine is offered in a open dinning room that overlooks the 18th hole of their private course.
reviews.title: Golf and beach resort- first rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: -Golf...Tiburon is well manicured course, difficult enough for most golfers and friendly staff
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: -Billiards…there is a billiards room on the first floor of this resort. My friends and I enjoyed healthy competition amidst the two flat screens in the billiards room that were pulsing college football during our stay.
reviews.title: Luxury with a value price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the first friendly welcome & glass of champage on arrival the service did not not fall short of excellent once.
reviews.title: Excellent Service at the Ritz in Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a bank holiday week-end and the hotel was very busy which is always a test and the service remaind first class. On the Sunday headed down to the Naples Beach resort & there was a line for the sun beds. We waited 10 minutes but the line was well organised and we had iced water on tap if needed. The lady who greeted all Ritz guests on the beach was so friendly she made the wait worthwhile. The waitress on the beach was first class & despite the heat & numbers of guests to attend she kept smiling & was excellent. We were pleased we chose the Golf resort as the Beach Resort hotel had lot's of families which would have been too much as we were having a grown-up couple of days away!
reviews.title: Another great weekend at the Ritz in Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and pet friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel a handful of times. Staying at a Ritz (especially this one) is like no other place. The staff is friendly and understand the meaning of SERVICE. Everyone who works in the hotel understands the concept of working for a Ritz. MAKE THE HOTEL GUEST HAPPY. Rooms are beautiful. Food and beverages are great. Pool staff is excellent. I do not play at their golf course as I choose to play elsewhere. But its a nice resort golf course. I will be back at least 2 more times before the snow birds come back. Only set back was the walls are thin and the kids next door where playing soccer in the room. Hotel security took care of that with a smile on their face. If feeling like the most important guest at the hotel is not important to you, dont bother staying here. Go stay at a holiday inn express. But if you like to be pampered by a sincere staff and stay at a first class hotel, come to the Ritz Golf Resort.
reviews.title: Excellent service and beautiful golfcourse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Attended a business function at the resort and spent the night in a very spacious, well appointed guest room overlooking the golf course. The staff was friendly and quick to say hello and help with anything requested. Nice lobby and bar area with plenty of room for socializing. Unfortunately I was not there to golf, but I'd highly recommend the resort to golfers. You'll feel right at home, even in your golf shoes! Also... it's pet friendly! They even had "dog pillows" for the pooches to lie down on on the outside patio. Nice touch!
reviews.title: Among the best of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz for 5 nights right before Thanksgiving. Everything about the hotel was wonderful. The property was beautiful inside and out. Our room was a nice size with a separate tub and shower. The staff all are very helpful and gracious. The complimentary shuttle to the Ritz Beach resort was a very nice touch.
reviews.title: Fantastic-loved every minute!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel did not seem very full. Consequently, it was very quiet and peaceful there. I never heard anyone walking by in the hallway, not even housekeeping, althogh I would always see their carts. I know there was someone staying right beside us, but I never heard a peep.
reviews.title: Paradise

likes.disliked: — Nothing except be prepared for an expensive propert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We only had a couple of glitches. Namely, didn't feel that housekeeping replenished toiletries as they should have and they kept trying to clean our room on checkout day before our late checkout time. Also, water pressure could have been stronger. But very minor points and did not really affect my overall experience.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — Staff hospitality, quality and cleanliness of the room, food quality
likes.disliked: — It's Florida, so you have to drive everywhere, but why leave?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, we enjoyed Sunday brunch which was wonderful. Very expensive, but all you can drink mimosas seemed to make the price a bit more bearable.
reviews.title: Ritz-Carlton Golf Resort - Our Honest Opinion
Great 5 day stay at the Golf Ritz Naples
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a quality, relaxing experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here for seven nights with my family of five in mid-March. This was the first time we stayed at this property and chose it over the beach resort solely on value. Traveling with three (almost adult) teenagers we needed two rooms to spread out, so cost was a deciding factor over the sister property. It certainly did NOT disappoint as once you check in to either resort, it’s like checking into one. You suddenly have the best of both worlds - a formal golf resort and a formal beach resort. Both have full reciprocating rights. Both offer complimentary shuttle service from 6:30 a.m. to at least 10:00 p.m. every half hour or drive back and forth, it’s a only a simple 10 minute drive.
reviews.title: Another Great Ritz-Carlton Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Since we did not golf, we actually utilized the beach property more, specifically the beach and all the wonderful amenities that the Ritz offers – towel service, chairs, cabanas, umbrellas, cocktails (albeit pricey) all executed by thoroughly professional staff who genuinely seem like “it’s their pleasure” to service you.
reviews.title: had a great time even though it was cold outside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Yes, as others have blogged, the beach property (particularly the family pool) was swarming with young children; it wasn’t crazy, just bustling – remember it was Spring Break. It made me smile that those days were long gone and we were on the beach – which was beautiful. They do offer an adult pool adjacent to the family option that was considerably lower key. We even lounged at the golf resort pool one afternoon and it was serene and pleasant. Again, it was serviced well by a professional staff.
reviews.title: Nice place for a golf weekend
Elegant/Great Service & Atmosphere
reviews.text: We ate off site six nights – all restaurants recommended by hotel concierge – all first class. One night we ate at The Grill – the beach resort’s formal dining room. It did not disappoint either; actually, it was the best of them all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely cannot go wrong with either property. I would say the beach property is slightly nicer; definitely wins with regard to fitness facility, spa (wow), dining options, and the beach within walking distance. But it does cost considerably more to stay here.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First-go off season and you will find some deals! Just over $100 a night. So with that said, we weren't expecting a lot at the rate, but it is a hidden gem in Naples. Although we stayed in a small room with a small balcony-we had good service, clean rooms and enjoyed the quiet. We didn't golf, and did use the small pool area. Not a resort-like the Ritz on the beach up the road-but we took the shuttle to the sister property and it was busy, loud and we were glad to get back to the smaller, quieter hotel. Food at the hotel was overpriced and not the best we have had, but it was good.
reviews.title: A quiet retreat in the off season

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice "small" fitness center, wanted to book a message but would have had to go over to the Beach Resort-wasn't a big deal but would have been nice to have more spa options at this hotel, if that is what you are going for, if not-it isn't a big deal
reviews.title: Nice - a little overpriced - only for golfers - hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Exceptional Christmas Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place off season, with good deals nice service and quiet-at least when we visited in May.
reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation with Pets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for New Year's eve (09-10).
reviews.title: Really nice trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent the week of April 21st at this resort and really loved it. We had a suite on the club level and it was fantastic. We have stayed at many Ritz resorts on the club and this one is up there with the best. The breakfast and lunch was great and the lounge was never crowded. The outdoor seating was great over looking the golf course and resort. The staff was good especially Janzcer, he took care of all of our needs. The service at this resort is top notch from check in, maid service and pool service.The shuttle to the beach was ok, always on time but the beach resort was very crowed. We are happy that we selected the golf resort. The golf resort is understated elegance. We had stayed at the beach resort about 12 years ago when kids were little. The beach resort is loaded with little kids. Our children are now 14 and 16. They were happy that we selected the golf resort as well. It was nice to spend day at beach and return to peace and quiet. We had rented a car which comes in handy to go out to dinner or shop. We went to 5th avenue to eat, stores close very early. We had a great dinner at Ruth's Chris in mall. Overall we had a nice relaxing time.
reviews.title: Another great Ritz Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Beautiful rooms overlooking the golf course with balcony. Rooms were of a decent size and well appointed with a large bathroom with seperate wc and seperate shower cubicle. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and the hotel has all the necessary touches of glamour that the ritz carlton has become known for. The pool area is lovely with plenty of space and a great pool bar/restaurant. The breakfast was absolutely fabulous with everything you could possibly need and more. There is a very well equipped gym with wonderful staff who are very helpful. Plenty of things to do at the hotel including snooker/pool tables, shops, a shuttle bus to the other resort which is on the beach, excellent restaurants and plenty of golf!! Internet access is also available. The whole resort is just lovely and a real luxurious retreat.
reviews.title: Luxury

likes.liked: — the constant high standards met throughout the resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel and staff are completely amazing...wonderful service...shuttle to beach resort is very easy...comes every half hour...golf resort is less busy and less chaotic then the beach resort...perfect getaway for a few days...pool area also very nice
reviews.title: a great getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I were able to enjoy a 1 night getaway last week at the Ritz Golf Resort in Naples while my kids stayed with my in laws in Ft. Myers Beach.
reviews.title: Perfect Getaway @ The Ritz!

likes.disliked: — That I had to leave it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a Resort View Club Level room & as we had an 8 AM tee time @ Tiburon arrived @ 7 AM (hubby has to go to the range!). We had planned to just drop our bag off & head over to the course but as there was a room available we were checked right in. To our pleasant surprise, the woman at check in said as there was only 1 empty room it was her pleasure to upgrade us to a golf course view room & we could go right up.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel A++ Service and Amenities

likes.liked: — Location, staff, & accomodations were all top notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: What an amazing hotel and staff! Attended a conference and while I didn't get a chance to enjoy the full scope of what the hotel had to offer, everything about my experience was top notch from the food to the service to the lovely accommodations. And having access to the beach amenities at the other Ritz on the ocean was a real treat - popped over for dinner and cocktails at their beach bar to watch the sunset. The best of both worlds!
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for one night at the Ritz Carlton Golf Resort and I was amazed at how beautiful the hotel is. the lobby and rooms are absolutely stunning and the staff were nothing but sincere and helpful.
reviews.title: lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location isn't too great but then again I'm not much of a golfer.
reviews.title: Excellent resort and golf package

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had ordered room service from the hotel's restaurant which was exceptional. I
reviews.title: Amazing place!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: I hope to be back very soon!
reviews.title: Two Hotels For The Price Of One

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: What a great stay... Went for 4th of July weekend with the family (wife and 2 kids... 5 and 2). We were 3 families together, total of 7 kids. We had an amazing time, stayed at a 1 bedroom suite and had a regular room with 2 double beds adjoining for a cousin who was with her 2 daughters. The hotel is great, the staff is very professional and always ready to help. From check in you have lemonade right by the check in desk. The rooms are very clean, turn down service was very good.
reviews.title: Amazing Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool is great for the kids, I actually prefer this pool than the one at the Beach property, this property also has a yard where they have bounce houses with water sprays so the kids can play there. There is also a volleyball net and lots of nets for soccer or lacrosse!
reviews.title: Everything you'd expect from a Ritz Carlton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The golf course is awesome, very narrow, but great conditions and the staff is very professional there.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall its an awesome place for the family! they have so many things for the kids and parents can eat at their restaurants and the kids have a playroom.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: I would recommend staying here instead of the beach. The other property is very crowded and everybody at the golf ends up in the beach during the day. This property is more relaxed and great conditions
reviews.title: Exactly what one would expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend, and it was great. We had an awesome rate including breakfast and a $75 credit per night- a steal. It was so, so worth it. We loved taking the shuttle to the beach and hanging out there, but the pool at the golf resort was like a quiet oasis.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Ritz Golf Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: At check in, when asking about the room view options, we were nicely upgraded to a better view over the pool- I definitely recommend that over a view of the front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great getaway, unbelievable staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent, although I wouldn't have eaten there if it wasn't part of my room rate, because it is a bit overpriced. The same as every Ritz. The only other meal we had was at the pool, and I had an excellent salad, although a bit steep in price.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it was an excellent stay and I hope to go back again.
reviews.title: Any smaller and I would call it a boutique hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: From the moment we drove up to this beautiful and extremely well maintained hotel we were treated like appreciated guests. The staff truly wanted our stay to be relaxed and enjoyable. Go over to the sister property on the beach a bit more posh and a few more amenities. the guys at the pool were great, giving out cool towels to wipe our faces, water was available as were apples. Go over to Gumbo Limbo and watch the sunset.
reviews.title: Tiburon Golf Resort- The Ritz's Red-Headed Stepchild

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from Naples where we stayed at the Ritz Golf Resort. Nice resort, but could use a little updating. The exact words I used to describe this resort to a friend was "I was expecting the Ritz to be similar to a Four Seasons, but instead what we got was a Westin." It was a nice hotel, but again, not what I would have expected out of a Ritz resort.
reviews.title: Not Exactly What I Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was hit and miss as far as friendliness. We received a free upgrade for our room, which was a pleasant surprise. However, that was overshadowed by some issues with our room, which took quite a bit of time to resolve. The food was not that great, and was even worse at the Beach Resort, so my recommendation is if you go to the resort on the beach, walk down to the Turtle Club to grab lunch, you won't be disappointed. They have an even better dinner (the best we had in Naples), but it was extremely difficult to get in.
reviews.title: Great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you plan on playing golf, plan on paying. Green fees were about $250 and an additional $65 if you have to rent clubs. I simply wasn't prepared to pay $300 to only play 18 holes.
reviews.title: What a Ritz should be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool area was great at both hotels and this is where my wife and I did enjoy ourselves. The staff was courteous and helpful with everything.
reviews.title: Continued excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We would stay at the Ritz-Carlton Golf Resort again, but again, depending on what you're expecting, you may be disappointed
reviews.title: Not what I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went for my birthday along with my husband for the weekend, and had a very nice stay. Upon arrival of course you are greated with smiles and common courtesy. I was wished a warm happy birthday and given a birthday card, inside was a coupon for a free bottle of wine and dessert but only if I ate at there restaurant. I chose not to. I wanted to venture out. But still thought that was a very nice touch. The room I booked was a standard room, 5th floor with partial view but still lovely wonderful special $139 a night, low seaon.
reviews.title: Romantic stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean. I was a little shocked to see a stain on the comforter, being that this is a Ritz Carlton but besides that everything else was perfect. It looked like a set in stain on the back of the comforter, when I pulled it off the bed I saw it and that was a little gross . But, honestly the room was very clean that was the only thing that was bad.
reviews.title: Fabulous place to stay and brilliant staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom for a standard room was pretty big, ALL MARBLE, Beatiful Shower, and the Blvgari Toiletries were a pleasant surprise. I really loved it. Bathrobes are wonderful. Just loved it.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is small, nothing spectacular that was a little disappointing, but there were not a lot of people there and it was very quiet and seemed private. This is there low season so occupancy is minamal. If it were full of people I would be a little uncomfortable with the size of pool. We ordered two beers by the pool and they came in nice glasses but the quantity was very little, less than a bottle in that glass and it was $16 when it was all said and done. For that price at least get a full bottle in your glass.
reviews.title: outstanding service, beautiful facilities, food is ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We did not play golf, but it looked spectacular, so for you golf lovers, I think you will like very much.
reviews.title: good, not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We want for the weekend and it was just wonderful. A very relaxing and lovely hotel. Service was perfect, everyone at the hotel could not have been more pleasant. The room was very clean, plenty of service. Could not have asked for more.
reviews.title: Just wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the ritz for three nights as part of our honeymoon and we had an amazing time. Firstly the hotel were very kind in upgrading us and sending a bottle of champagne to the room as we were on honeymoon. it was a lovely touch and added greatly to our stay. All the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was great and the grounds were amazing.
reviews.title: The Best hotel we ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though the ritz was more old school than other hotel's we stayed in during our trip, and we were a young couple on honeymoon this didnt stop this hotel genuinely being the best we have ever stayed in. We found the food menu reasonably priced for a five star hotel and we ate there and it was really good quality.
reviews.title: Luxury, beautiful golf and friendly, professional staff make Ritz-Carlton an ideal destination for a short break.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just to give you an example of how great their customer service was there was a power cut one morning during our stay and the ritz added $50 resort credit to our account for any trouble it might have caused us. i dont know what else i can say to impress on others what a fantastic time they will have if the come to this hotel.
reviews.title: Great vocation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the only downside was the pool area was very busy when we were there but this was because it was around the time of independence day and there were lots of kids on vacation with their parents.
reviews.title: A very nice visit in the off season

aka: The Ritz-Carlton Golf Resort, Naples Hotel Naples
description: Surround yourself with the rolling green vistas of North America's premier golf setting. The Ritz-Carlton Golf Resort, Naples boasts two Greg Norman-designed courses that will satisfy even the most discerning player’s expectations. Challenge yourself on the green, then retreat to unrivaled luxury of Florida’s top-rated golf resort hotel. The Ritz-Carlton Golf Resort, Naples is a AAA Five-Diamond, Mobil Four-Star Mediterranean-style sanctuary that offers 295 well-appointed guest rooms, including 31 club rooms, 40 suites and a Presidential Suite, as well as three exceptional dining establishments, 12 unique, spacious meeting rooms, the Tiburon Golf Course and a large pool area with poolside service. Guests at The Ritz-Carlton Golf Resort, Naples are also encouraged to enjoy access to the services and amenities at the neighboring Ritz-Carlton, Naples beach resort via a complimentary shuttle service between the resorts. Only three miles away, The Ritz-Carlton, Naples beach resort boast dazzling views of the Gulf of Mexico, warm golden sunsets, three miles of pristine beach, seven unique restaurants and a world-class spa.
